pr_title: Make IAM able to re display multiple times

timeline.bodyText: displaysQuantity should be displayQuantity
timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.bodyText: displaysLimit should be displayLimit
timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText: Let's make display limit default to 1 since normal IAMs only show once?
replies.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText: taking https://github.com/OneSignal/engineering/pull/92/files as reference, it says that if limit is missing make it MAX_INT
replies.author: Jeasmine

replies.bodyText: @jkasten2 Did we decide to keep this MAX_INT as default?
replies.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText: Yes, we can use MAX_INT incase the backend passes back a redisplay section but without any params. @mikechoch This property was moved to OSInAppMessageDisplayStats so I think this is more clear now. Marking this as resolved.
replies.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText: Lets rename delay to displayDelay, so it is a little more specific
timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.bodyText:
reDisplayEnabled should be redisplayEnabled
Redisplay is one word, so no capitol D
timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.bodyText:
increaseDisplayQuantity should be incrementDisplayQuantity
increase could be any quantity, increment means to add 1 to a current value
timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.bodyText: isRemainingDisplays should be shouldDisplayAgain
timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.bodyText: Why aren't we using the previous messages instead?
timeline.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText:
do you mean ArrayList messages?
i think is more clear to have separate responsibilities. But i can mix the logic to whenever the message is set add the data for redisplay,  although it will trigger another for loop. We can discuss this if you want
replies.author: Jeasmine
mikechoch

replies.bodyText: yeah i can mix the logics
replies.author: Jeasmine

replies.bodyText:
I think we should have a single @NonNull private ArrayList<OSInAppMessage> messages; that contains on IAMs pulled down for the current session
I cant tell if you are agreeing or not haha?
replies.author: mikechoch

replies.bodyText:
@mikechoch and I talked about this. Our ArrayList<OSInAppMessage> messages is a list of all IAMs from our server so we should keep this list untouched.
To read and write our two new properties I think we should create a new class to store them under. We can call this something like OSInAppMessageDisplayStats which will hold our displayQuantity and lastTimeDisplayed. This can still be referenced by OSInAppMessage as a property.
replies.author: jkasten2

replies.bodyText: ok that make sense. I agree with that the message list should kept untouched.
replies.author: Jeasmine

timeline.bodyText: dismissedAndToDismissMessages should be dismissedMessages, no need to over complicate the name
timeline.author: mikechoch

Why is this

here?

timeline.bodyText: This if would never be true as we new up a OSInAppMessageDummyController instead for per 4.4 devices.

replies.author: Jeasmine

timeline.bodyText: nit, remove space after (
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText:
Here we need to add a check to only re-display if a trigger was updated that is in this IAM's trigger set.
This prevents the IAM from reshowing over and over until it hits it's display limit since evaluateInAppMessages is called each time an IAM is dismissed.
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.message:
Add OSInAppMessageDisplayStats stats and trigger validation

  * Only IAM that have their triggers changed and can redisplay may redisplay

timeline.bodyText: ReDisplay should be Redisplay
timeline.author: mikechoch

timeline.message: Rename to redisplay

timeline.bodyText: We need to also call checkTriggerChanges() in removeTriggersForKeys as well, as they could have a condition to display on trigger does not exists.
timeline.author: jkasten2

replies.bodyText: ok, i had doubts about this
replies.author: Jeasmine

timeline.message: Improve code

timeline.bodyText: We can clean up this DateGenerator by using  System.currentTimeMillis()  instead.  This way we can use advanceSystemTimeBy in our tests for mocking time.

timeline.message:
Add TimeTravel to testing

  * Remove thread sleep
  * Add Date generator to mock new date times for delays
  * Add remove trigger test

Add TimeTravel to testing

  * Remove thread sleep
  * Add Date generator to mock new date times for delays
  * Add remove trigger test

Display once per session IAM with redisplay

   * Add no trigger check, display once per session
   * Add displayed param to IAM
   * Add test for cold start and init OneSignal

Make IAM able to re display multiple times

  * Changes on OSInAppMessage class, add two new params delay and limit
  * Make OSInAppMessageController handle the multiple re displays
  * Save on local database quantity of displays and last display time per IAM
  * Add unit test for new functionality

Remove IAM from db

  * Remove IAMs with redisplay from DB when lastDisplay is
    older than six month

Display once per session IAM with redisplay

   * Add no trigger check, display once per session
   * Add displayed param to IAM
   * Add test for cold start and init OneSignal

  * Changes parts of IAMSController
